activities:
Merck & Co., Inc. and its wholly-owned U.S. subsidiaries receive personal data from the EU/EEA and Switzerland including data concerning:
- employees, potential employees and their family members
- former employees
- contractors and contingent workers
- scientific and medical research subjects
- scientific and medical investigators and staff
- scientific and ethics committee members
- service providers and business partners
- consultants
- consumers
- investors and shareholders 
- medical and health care professionals
- customers
- suppliers
- vendors
- government officials
- industry experts and opinion leaders

These data are collected and transferred to the U.S. in support of the company's employment, research, development, regulatory, marketing, sales, financial, legal and other business activities.
corpofftitle1: EVP & Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources
recoursemech: For human resources data: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) Panel and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC); For all other types of data: TRUSTe
